title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Edmonds Community College
Interview Descriptions: Excellent interview process. I enjoyed answering all the questions. It was a panel of 9 staff members. I think they were approachable and made me feel comfortable. Questions were given an HR in advance.
Interview Questions: Interview questions included role play

title: Full-time Faculty Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Edmonds Community College
Interview Descriptions: I was told the interview would include a series of questions and an online teaching demonstration. The exact parameters of the teaching demonstration were a bit unclear. Upon beginning the interview, it because clear that the members of the committee had competing agendas, so the meeting became quite awkward and--needless to say--didn't go well.
Interview Questions: What inventive ideas to you have to invigorate community in the department and to incorporate associate faculty voices?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Edmonds Community College
Interview Descriptions: Applied on the government jobs website, got an initial invite, 15 before the interview got an e-mail from HR with the questions of the interview so I could prepare. Interviews and correspondence were all made on time, easy onboarding process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: International Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Edmonds Community College
Interview Descriptions: apply with personal letter of description why do you apply for this job and also need to introduce yourself such as your culture, your experiences, and else. Then they select the people that they want to interview. Just need to show up in timely manner.
Interview Questions: Why would we hire you in this job?

title: Internation Admissions Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Edmonds Community College
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received a phone call next day to schedule an interview on-site. Interview took 30 minutes with two managers. 6 questions and an easy Excel skills test.
Interview Questions: Describe two experiences working with a diverse population.

title: Coordinator for Residential Education Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Edmonds Community College (Lynnwood, WA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
15 min prep, 45 min interview with staff followed by 45 min interview with housing student staff and Director of Housing 
Wonderful experience learning more about his unique community. 100% international students in homestay program and 50% international students in residential community.
Interview Questions: What are some of the issues or challenges that you feel students currently face in community colleges? How are they different than issues faced by university students? How would these impact your role?

title: Marketing Programs Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Edmonds Community College (Lynnwood, WA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: First a phone interview of about 15 minutes. Then an in person panel interview (about an hour). This panel interview included giving a short presentation to the group. Then a final interview with just 2 people (about 30 minutes). All in all the process was pleasant and not "tricky".
Interview Questions: What are some obstacles that current students face when trying to succeed at a community college.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Edmonds Community College (Lynnwood, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick interview. An experienced lab assistant was the interviewer.  I was asked basic questions and finished it within 30 minutes.  It was fairly easy to pass indeed.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Edmonds Community College (Lynnwood, WA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Friendly recruiter, easy questions, they ask me more if I know anything about the position and I ask them again what they like about their position? While some interviews may feel more like interrogations, the recruiters are very friendly.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you took a leadership role. What was the outcome?

title: Executive Assistant to Chief Executive Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Edmonds Community College (Lynnwood, WA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
- 1 round interview. Mostly behavioral questions. The interviewers are students, so they dont ask really tricky question. However, it was really interesting. 
- There are aboy 15 questions and each candidate has 30 mins for them plus 15 mins prepare the answers beforehand.
Interview Questions: How I value diversity? What is the most important aspect of diversity? How can I promote diversity on the campus

title: Engineering Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Edmonds Community College (Edmonds, WA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I sat around a table with about 6 other people. At the start of the interview I was asked to give a 20 minute lesson that would be appropriate for a lower division mechanical engineering class. I was told about this part in advance so I was able to prepare. During the lesson, the interviewers asked me questions just like they would in class. After the lesson they interviewers each asked me a succession of 12 prewritten questions. They were not allowed to deviate in their questioning but I was encouraged to elaborate on my answers.
Interview Questions: How do you engage women and minority students, some of whom don't speak english well?

title: Translator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Edmonds Community College (Lynnwood, WA)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was easy and very comfortable
I interviewed with two supervisors and the questions were common.
Nothing were difficulty in answering for the questions if you had some preparation in prior. 
Just know the nature of the job, employer expectation, and how are you planning to manage the work balance with them.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you have to work within deadline?

title: Groundskeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Edmonds Community College (Lynnwood, WA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: As I was working there as international student, the hiring process was rather long due to some paper that I needed to get started but usually the hiring process takes one to two days
Interview Questions: Are you able to do the work?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Edmonds Community College
Interview Descriptions: I thought the interview process was pretty informal and basic. The whole process was about 20mins long. Firstly. I got in and check in with my supervisor which interviewed me, then went over my letter of recommendation and transcripts to get a sense of my qualifications and credentials. He then start asking about precious employment experiences and information. Basic minimum wage pay
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Edmonds Community College (Lynnwood, WA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Excessive written supplemental questions--- seeks details that are far more clearly communicated in an interview.  High emphasis on written answers to clear for interview.  Committee of peers or department members also makes it a chemistry challenge and internal candidates seem to have an inordinately high level of success...vs "from the outside"
Interview Questions: A problem is described and you discuss approach

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Edmonds Community College (Lynnwood, WA)
Interview Descriptions:
The process of interview is really easy. They ask for transcripts so that they can check which classes you can tutor on. Once there, they ask you about your experience tutoring, and how can you help students understand the concepts of the classes. 
They ask about working experience, and how is it related to the department, in this case, TRiO.
Interview Questions: There was not a really hard question. It was more about sharing your experience, and explaining the reasons for applying for the tutor position.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Edmonds Community College (Lynnwood, WA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, answered some essay questions about my professional and academic experiences and was invited onsite to be interviewed by the hiring committee for that position.  During the interview, members of the committee asked me questions that reflected the domain I wished to teach then I was asked to provide a 10-15 minute lecture on a specific subject from my domain of expertise.
Interview Questions: Sorry, but none of the questions seemed that hard.
